project.name: postprocessing
project.description: A post processing library that provides the means to implement 2D filter effects for three.js.

materials.name: materials
materials.description: A collection of shader materials that are used in the post processing passes.

passes.name: passes
passes.description: A compilation of the post processing passes.

EffectComposer.name: EffectComposer
EffectComposer.description:
The EffectComposer may be used in place of a normal WebGLRenderer.

The auto clear behaviour of the provided renderer will be disabled to prevent
unnecessary clear operations.

It is common practice to use a {{#crossLink "RenderPass"}}{{/crossLink}} as
the first pass to automatically clear the screen and render the scene to a
texture for further processing.

params.name: renderer
params.description: - The renderer that should be used.

props.name: depthBuffer
props.description: - Whether the main render targets should have a depth buffer.

props.name: stencilBuffer
props.description: - Whether the main render targets should have a stencil buffer.

props.name: depthTexture
props.description: - Set to true if one of your passes relies on a depth texture.

BokehMaterial.name: BokehMaterial
BokehMaterial.description:
Depth of Field shader (Bokeh).

Original shader code by Martins Upitis:
 http://artmartinsh.blogspot.com/2010/02/glsl-lens-blur-filter-with-bokeh.html

props.name: focus
props.description: - Focus distance.

props.name: aperture
props.description: - Camera aperture scale. Bigger values for shallower depth of field.

props.name: maxBlur
props.description: - Maximum blur strength.

Bokeh2Material.name: Bokeh2Material
Bokeh2Material.description:
Depth of Field shader version 2.

Original shader code by Martins Upitis:
 http://blenderartists.org/forum/showthread.php?237488-GLSL-depth-of-field-with-bokeh-v2-4-(update)

props.name: texelSize
props.description: - The absolute screen texel size.

props.name: showFocus
props.description: - Whether the focus point should be highlighted.

props.name: manualDoF
props.description: - Enables manual depth of field blur.

props.name: vignette
props.description: - Enables a vignette effect.

props.name: pentagon
props.description: - Enable to use a pentagonal shape to scale gathered texels.

props.name: shaderFocus
props.description: - Disable if you compute your own focalDepth (in metres!).

props.name: noise
props.description: - Disable if you don't want noise patterns for dithering.

CombineMaterial.name: CombineMaterial
CombineMaterial.description:
A material for combining two textures.

This material supports the two blend modes Add and Screen.

In Screen mode, the two textures are effectively projected on a white screen
simultaneously. In Add mode, the textures are simply added together which
often produces washed out results.

params.name: screenMode
params.description: - Whether the screen blend mode should be used.

ConvolutionMaterial.name: ConvolutionMaterial
ConvolutionMaterial.description:
An optimised convolution shader material.

Based on the GDC2003 Presentation by Masaki Kawase, Bunkasha Games:
 Frame Buffer Postprocessing Effects in DOUBLE-S.T.E.A.L (Wreckless)
and an article by Filip Strugar, Intel:
 An investigation of fast real-time GPU-based image blur algorithms

Further modified according to:
 https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/3DDrawing/Conceptual/OpenGLES_ProgrammingGuide/BestPracticesforShaders/BestPracticesforShaders.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40008793-CH7-SW15

params.name: average
params.description: - Whether the shader should output the colour average (black and white).

FilmMaterial.name: FilmMaterial
FilmMaterial.description:
A cinematic shader that provides the following effects:
 - Film Grain
 - Scanlines
 - Vignette
 - Greyscale
 - Sepia

Original scanlines algorithm by Pat "Hawthorne" Shearon.
 http://www.truevision3d.com/forums/showcase/staticnoise_colorblackwhite_scanline_shaders-t18698.0.html

Optimized scanlines and noise with intensity scaling by Georg "Leviathan"
Steinrohder. (This version is provided under a Creative Commons Attribution
3.0 License: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0)

The sepia effect is based on:
 https://github.com/evanw/glfx.js

The vignette code is based on PaintEffect postprocess from ro.me:
 http://code.google.com/p/3-dreams-of-black/source/browse/deploy/js/effects/PaintEffect.js

props.name: greyscale
props.description: - Enable greyscale effect. Greyscale and sepia are mutually exclusive.

props.name: sepia
props.description: - Enable sepia effect. Greyscale and sepia are mutually exclusive.

props.name: vignette
props.description: - Apply vignette effect.

props.name: eskil
props.description: - Use Eskil's vignette approach. The default looks dusty while Eskil looks burned out.

props.name: screenMode
props.description: - Whether the screen blend mode should be used for noise and scanlines. Both of these effects are computed independently.

props.name: noise
props.description: - Show noise-based film grain.

props.name: scanlines
props.description: - Show scanlines.

props.name: noiseIntensity
props.description: - The noise intensity. 0.0 to 1.0.

props.name: scanlineIntensity
props.description: - The scanline intensity. 0.0 to 1.0.

props.name: greyscaleIntensity
props.description: - The intensity of the greyscale effect.

props.name: sepiaIntensity
props.description: - The intensity of the sepia effect.

props.name: vignetteOffset
props.description: - The offset of the vignette effect.

props.name: vignetteDarkness
props.description: - The darkness of the vignette effect.

GlitchMaterial.name: GlitchMaterial
GlitchMaterial.description:
A glitch shader material.

Reference:
 https://github.com/staffantan/unityglitch

GodRaysMaterial.name: GodRaysMaterial
GodRaysMaterial.description:
A crepuscular rays shader material.

References:

Thibaut Despoulain, 2012:
 (WebGL) Volumetric Light Approximation in Three.js
 http://bkcore.com/blog/3d/webgl-three-js-volumetric-light-godrays.html

Nvidia, GPU Gems 3, 2008:
 Chapter 13. Volumetric Light Scattering as a Post-Process
 http://http.developer.nvidia.com/GPUGems3/gpugems3_ch13.html

LuminosityMaterial.name: LuminosityMaterial
LuminosityMaterial.description:
A luminance shader material.

This shader produces a greyscale luminance map. It can also be configured to
output colors that are scaled with their respective luminance value.
Additionally, a range may be provided to mask out undesired texels.

The alpha channel will remain unaffected in all cases.

Luminance range reference:
 https://cycling74.com/2007/05/23/your-first-shader/#.Vty9FfkrL4Z

params.name: color
params.description: - Defines whether the shader should output colours scaled with their luminance value.

params.name: range
params.description: - If provided, the shader will mask out texels that aren't in the specified luminance range.

PixelationMaterial.name: PixelationMaterial
PixelationMaterial.description:
A pixelation shader material.

Original shader code by Robert Casanova:
 https://github.com/robertcasanova/pixelate-shader

ShockWaveMaterial.name: ShockWaveMaterial
ShockWaveMaterial.description:
A shock wave shader material.

Based on a Gist by Jean-Philippe Sarda:
 https://gist.github.com/jpsarda/33cea67a9f2ecb0a0eda

props.name: waveSize
props.description: - The wave size.

props.name: amplitude
props.description: - The distortion amplitude.

SMAABlendMaterial.name: SMAABlendMaterial
SMAABlendMaterial.description:
Subpixel Morphological Antialiasing.

This material is used to render the final antialiasing.

SMAAColorEdgesMaterial.name: SMAAColorEdgesMaterial
SMAAColorEdgesMaterial.description:
Subpixel Morphological Antialiasing.

This material detects edges in a color texture.

SMAAWeightsMaterial.name: SMAAWeightsMaterial
SMAAWeightsMaterial.description:
Subpixel Morphological Antialiasing.

This material computes weights for detected edges.

BloomPass.name: BloomPass
BloomPass.description:
A bloom pass.

This pass renders a scene with superimposed blur by utilising the fast Kawase
convolution approach.

props.name: resolutionScale
props.description: - The render texture resolution scale, relative to the screen render size.

props.name: kernelSize
props.description: - The blur kernel size.

props.name: intensity
props.description: - The strength of the bloom effect.

props.name: distinction
props.description: - The luminance distinction factor. Raise this value to bring out the brighter elements in the scene.

props.name: screenMode
props.description: - Whether the screen blend mode should be used for combining the bloom texture with the scene colors.

props.name: resolutionScale
props.description: - The render texture resolution scale, relative to the screen render size.

props.name: kernelSize
props.description: - The blur kernel size.

BokehPass.name: BokehPass
BokehPass.description:
A Depth of Field (DoF) pass using a bokeh shader.

This pass requires a
{{#crossLink "EffectComposer/depthTexture:property"}}{{/crossLink}}.

params.name: camera
params.description: - The main camera. Used to obtain the aspect ratio and the near and far plane settings.

props.name: focus
props.description: - Focus distance.

props.name: aperture
props.description: - Camera aperture scale. Bigger values for shallower depth of field.

props.name: maxBlur
props.description: - Maximum blur strength.

Bokeh2Pass.name: Bokeh2Pass
Bokeh2Pass.description:
An advanced Depth of Field (DoF) pass.

Yields more realistic results but is also more demanding.

This pass requires a
{{#crossLink "EffectComposer/depthTexture:property"}}{{/crossLink}}.

params.name: camera
params.description: - The main camera. Used to obtain the focal length and the near and far plane settings.

props.name: rings
props.description: - The amount of blur rings.

props.name: samples
props.description: - The amount of samples per ring.

props.name: showFocus
props.description: - Whether the focus point should be highlighted.

props.name: manualDoF
props.description: - Enables manual depth of field blur.

props.name: vignette
props.description: - Enables a vignette effect.

props.name: pentagon
props.description: - Enable to use a pentagonal shape to scale gathered texels.

props.name: shaderFocus
props.description: - Disable if you compute your own focalDepth (in metres!).

props.name: noise
props.description: - Disable if you don't want noise patterns for dithering.

ClearMaskPass.name: ClearMaskPass
ClearMaskPass.description: A pass that disables the stencil mask.

ClearPass.name: ClearPass
ClearPass.description:
A clear pass.

You can prevent specific buffers from being cleared by setting either the
autoClearColor, autoClearStencil or autoClearDepth properties of the renderer
to false.

props.name: clearColor
props.description: - An override clear color.

props.name: clearAlpha
props.description: - An override clear alpha.

DepthPass.name: DepthPass
DepthPass.description:
A depth pass.

Reads the depth from a depth texture and renders it.

This pass requires a
{{#crossLink "EffectComposer/depthTexture:property"}}{{/crossLink}}.

params.name: camera
params.description: - The main camera. Used to obtain the near and far plane settings.

props.name: angle
props.description: - The angle of the pattern.

props.name: scale
props.description: - The scale of the overall effect.

props.name: intensity
props.description: - The intensity of the effect.

props.name: average
props.description: - Whether the shader should output a colour average (black and white).

FilmPass.name: FilmPass
FilmPass.description: A film pass providing various cinematic effects.

props.name: greyscale
props.description: - Enable greyscale effect. Greyscale and sepia are mutually exclusive.

props.name: sepia
props.description: - Enable sepia effect. Greyscale and sepia are mutually exclusive.

props.name: vignette
props.description: - Apply vignette effect.

props.name: eskil
props.description: - Use Eskil's vignette approach. The default looks dusty while Eskil looks more burned out.

props.name: screenMode
props.description: - Whether the screen blend mode should be used for noise and scanlines.

props.name: scanlines
props.description: - Show scanlines.

props.name: noise
props.description: - Show noise-based film grain.

props.name: noiseIntensity
props.description: - The noise intensity. 0.0 to 1.0.

props.name: scanlineIntensity
props.description: - The scanline intensity. 0.0 to 1.0.

props.name: scanlineDensity
props.description: - The number of scanlines in percent, relative to the screen height.

props.name: greyscaleIntensity
props.description: - The intensity of the greyscale effect.

props.name: sepiaIntensity
props.description: - The intensity of the sepia effect.

props.name: vignetteOffset
props.description: - The offset of the vignette effect.

props.name: vignetteDarkness
props.description: - The darkness of the vignette effect.

props.name: perturbMap
props.description: - A perturbation map. If none is provided, a noise texture will be created.

props.name: dtSize
props.description: - The size of the generated noise map. Will be ignored if a perturbation map is provided.

props.name: density
props.description: - The density of the light rays.

props.name: decay
props.description: - An illumination decay factor.

props.name: weight
props.description: - A light ray weight factor.

props.name: exposure
props.description: - A constant attenuation coefficient.

props.name: clampMax
props.description: - An upper bound for the saturation of the overall effect.

props.name: intensity
props.description: - A constant factor for additive blending.

props.name: resolutionScale
props.description: - The render texture resolution scale, relative to the screen render size.

props.name: kernelSize
props.description: - The blur kernel size.

props.name: samples
props.description: - The number of samples per pixel.

props.name: screenMode
props.description: - Whether the screen blend mode should be used for combining the god rays texture with the scene colors.

Pass.name: Pass
Pass.description:
An abstract pass.

Passes that do not rely on the depth buffer should explicitly disable the
depth test and depth write in their respective shader materials.

This class implements a {{#crossLink "Pass/dispose:method"}}{{/crossLink}}
method that frees memory on demand.

params.name: quad
params.description: - A quad that fills the screen to render 2D filter effects. Set this to null, if you don't need it (see {{#crossLink "RenderPass"}}{{/crossLink}}).

RenderPass.name: RenderPass
RenderPass.description:
A pass that renders a given scene directly on screen or into the read buffer
for further processing.

params.name: camera
params.description: - The camera to use to render the scene.

props.name: overrideMaterial
props.description: - An override material for the scene.

props.name: clearColor
props.description: - An override clear color.

props.name: clearAlpha
props.description: - An override clear alpha.

props.name: clearDepth
props.description: - Whether depth should be cleared explicitly.

props.name: clear
props.description: - Whether all buffers should be cleared.

SavePass.name: SavePass
SavePass.description: A pass that renders the result from a previous pass to another render target.

params.name: renderTarget
params.description: - The render target to use for saving the read buffer.

params.name: resize
params.description: - Whether the render target should adjust to the size of the read/write buffer.

ShaderPass.name: ShaderPass
ShaderPass.description:
A shader pass.

Used to render any shader material as a 2D filter.

params.name: epicenter
params.description: - The world position of the shock wave epicenter.

props.name: speed
props.description: - The animation speed.

props.name: maxRadius
props.description: - The extent of the shock wave.

props.name: waveSize
props.description: - The wave size.

props.name: amplitude
props.description: - The distortion amplitude.

SMAAPass.name: SMAAPass
SMAAPass.description:
Subpixel Morphological Antialiasing (SMAA) v2.8.

Preset: SMAA 1x Medium (with color edge detection).
 https://github.com/iryoku/smaa/releases/tag/v2.8

params.name: Image
params.description: - This pass requires an Image class to create internal textures. Provide window.Image in a browser environment.

TexturePass.name: TexturePass
TexturePass.description:
A texture pass.

Renders a given texture.

ToneMappingPass.name: ToneMappingPass
ToneMappingPass.description:
A tone mapping pass that supports adaptive luminosity.

If adaptivity is enabled, this pass generates a texture that represents the
luminosity of the current scene and adjusts it over time to simulate the
optic nerve responding to the amount of light it is receiving.

Reference:
 GDC2007 - Wolfgang Engel, Post-Processing Pipeline
 http://perso.univ-lyon1.fr/jean-claude.iehl/Public/educ/GAMA/2007/gdc07/Post-Processing_Pipeline.pdf

props.name: adaptive
props.description: - Whether the tone mapping should use an adaptive luminance map.

props.name: resolution
props.description: - The render texture resolution.

props.name: distinction
props.description: - A luminance distinction factor.

classitems.description:
The renderer.

You may replace the renderer at any time by using the
{{#crossLink "EffectComposer/replaceRenderer:method"}}{{/crossLink}}
method.
classitems.name: renderer

classitems.description:
The read buffer.

Reading from and writing to the same render target should be avoided.
Therefore, two seperate yet identical buffers are used.
classitems.name: readBuffer

classitems.description: A copy pass used for copying masked scenes.
classitems.name: copyPass

classitems.description:
The depth texture of the read and write buffers.

The read and write buffers share a single depth texture. Depth will be
written to this texture when something is rendered into one of the buffers
and the involved materials have depth write enabled.

You may enable this mechanism during the instantiation of the composer or
by assigning a DepthTexture instance later on. You may also disable it by
assigning null.
classitems.name: depthTexture

classitems.description:
Replaces the current renderer with the given one. The DOM element of the
current renderer will automatically be removed from its parent node and the
DOM element of the new renderer will take its place.

The auto clear mechanism of the provided renderer will be disabled.

Switching between renderers allows you to dynamically enable or disable
antialiasing.
classitems.name: replaceRenderer

classitems.description:
Creates a new render target by replicating the renderer's canvas.

The created render target uses a linear filter for texel minification and
magnification. Its render texture format depends on whether the renderer
uses the alpha channel. Mipmaps are disabled.
classitems.name: createBuffer

params.name: depthBuffer
params.description: - Whether the render target should have a depth buffer.

params.name: stencilBuffer
params.description: - Whether the render target should have a stencil buffer.

params.name: depthTexture
params.description: - Whether the render target should have a depth texture.

return.description: A new render target that equals the renderer's canvas.

classitems.description: Adds a pass, optionally at a specific index.
classitems.name: addPass

params.name: index
params.description: - An index at which the pass should be inserted.

classitems.description: Renders all enabled passes in the order in which they were added.
classitems.name: render

params.name: delta
params.description: - The time between the last frame and the current one in seconds.

classitems.description:
Sets the size of the buffers and the renderer's output canvas.

Every pass will be informed of the new size. It's up to each pass how that
information is used.

If no width or height is specified, the render targets and passes will be
updated with the current size of the renderer.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description: Resets this composer by deleting all passes and creating new buffers.
classitems.name: reset

params.name: renderTarget
params.description: - A new render target. If none is provided, the settings of the renderer will be used.

classitems.description:
Destroys all passes and render targets.

This method deallocates all render targets, textures and materials created
by the passes. It also deletes this composer's frame buffers.
classitems.name: dispose

params.name: renderTarget
params.description: - A new render target. If none is provided, the composer will become inoperative.

classitems.description: Adopts the settings of the given camera.
classitems.name: adoptCameraSettings

classitems.description: Adopts the near and far plane and the focal length of the given camera.
classitems.name: adoptCameraSettings

classitems.description: A very small kernel that matches a 7x7 Gauss blur kernel.
classitems.name: VERY_SMALL

classitems.description: A small kernel that matches a 15x15 Gauss blur kernel.
classitems.name: SMALL

classitems.description: A medium sized kernel that matches a 23x23 Gauss blur kernel.
classitems.name: MEDIUM

classitems.description: A large kernel that matches a 35x35 Gauss blur kernel.
classitems.name: LARGE

classitems.description: A very large kernel that matches a 63x63 Gauss blur kernel.
classitems.name: VERY_LARGE

classitems.description: A huge kernel that matches a 127x127 Gauss blur kernel.
classitems.name: HUGE

classitems.description: Adopts the settings of the given camera.
classitems.name: adoptCameraSettings

classitems.description:
The resolution scale.

You need to call
{{#crossLink "EffectComposer/setSize:method"}}{{/crossLink}} after changing
this value.
classitems.name: resolutionScale

classitems.description: The overall intensity of the effect.
classitems.name: intensity

classitems.description:
Renders the effect.

Extracts a luminance map from the read buffer, blurs it and combines it
with the read buffer.

classitems.description: Adjusts the format of the render targets.

params.description: - Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

The resolution scale.

You need to call
{{#crossLink "EffectComposer/setSize:method"}}{{/crossLink}} after changing
this value.
classitems.name: resolutionScale

classitems.description: Adjusts the format of the render targets.
classitems.name: initialise

params.name: alpha
params.description: - Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

classitems.description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

classitems.description: Used for saving the original clear color of the renderer.
classitems.name: CLEAR_COLOR

classitems.description: Clears the read buffer or the screen.

classitems.description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

The amount of scanlines in percent, relative to the screen height.

You need to call
{{#crossLink "EffectComposer/setSize:method"}}{{/crossLink}} after changing
this value.
classitems.name: scanlineDensity

classitems.description: Adjusts the scanline count using the renderer's height.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description: Returns a random integer in the specified range.
classitems.name: randomInt

classitems.description: Returns a random float in the specified range.
classitems.name: randomFloat

classitems.description: Counter for glitch activation and deactivation.
classitems.name: counter

classitems.description: A random break point for the sporadic glitch activation.
classitems.name: breakPoint

classitems.description: Deletes the current perturbation map and creates a new one.
classitems.name: generatePerturbMap

classitems.description: A scene that only contains the light source.
classitems.name: lightScene

classitems.description: A pass that only renders the light source.
classitems.name: renderPassLight

classitems.description: A pass that renders the masked scene over the light.
classitems.name: renderPassMask

classitems.description: A render target for the masked light scene.
classitems.name: renderTargetMask

classitems.description: The light position in screen space.
classitems.name: screenPosition

classitems.description:
The resolution scale.

You need to call
{{#crossLink "EffectComposer/setSize:method"}}{{/crossLink}} after changing
this value.
classitems.name: resolutionScale

classitems.description: The overall intensity of the effect.
classitems.name: intensity

classitems.description:
The number of samples per pixel.

This value must be carefully chosen. A higher value increases the GPU load.
classitems.name: samples

classitems.description:
Renders the scene.

The god rays pass has four phases:

Mask Phase:
 First, the light source is rendered. Then the scene is rendered into the
 same buffer using a mask override material with depth test enabled.

Preliminary Blur Phase:
 The masked scene is blurred.

God Rays Phase:
 The blurred scene is blurred again, but this time along radial lines
 towards the light source.

Composite Phase:
 The final result is combined with the read buffer.
classitems.name: render

classitems.description: Adjusts the format of the render targets.
classitems.name: initialise

params.name: alpha
params.description: - Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

classitems.description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description:
A quad mesh that fills the screen.

Assign your shader material to this mesh!
classitems.name: quad

classitems.description:
Indicates whether the read and write buffers should be swapped after this
pass has finished rendering.

Set this to true if this pass renders to the write buffer so that a
following pass can find the result in the read buffer.
classitems.name: needsSwap

classitems.description:
Renders the effect.

This is an abstract method that must be overridden.
classitems.name: render

throws.description: An error is thrown if the method is not overridden.

params.name: readBuffer
params.description: - A read buffer. Contains the result of the previous pass.

params.name: writeBuffer
params.description: - A write buffer. Normally used as the render target when the read buffer is used as input.

params.name: maskActive
params.description: - Indicates whether a stencil test mask is active or not.

classitems.description:
Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

This is an abstract method that may be overridden in case you want to be
informed about the main render size.

The {{#crossLink "EffectComposer"}}{{/crossLink}} calls this method before
this pass is initialised and every time its own size is updated.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description:
Performs initialisation tasks.

By implementing this abstract method you gain access to the renderer.
You'll also be able to configure your custom render targets to use the
appropriate format (RGB or RGBA).

The provided renderer can be used to warm up special off-screen render
targets by performing a preliminary render operation.

The {{#crossLink "EffectComposer"}}{{/crossLink}} calls this method when
this pass is added to its queue.
classitems.name: initialise

params.name: alpha
params.description: - Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

classitems.description:
Performs a shallow search for properties that define a dispose method and
deletes them. The pass will be inoperative after this method was called!

Disposable objects:
 - render targets
 - materials
 - textures

The {{#crossLink "EffectComposer"}}{{/crossLink}} calls this method when it
is being destroyed. You may, however, use it independently to free memory
when you are certain that you don't need this pass anymore.
classitems.name: dispose

classitems.description: The pixel granularity. A higher value yields coarser visuals.
classitems.name: granularity

classitems.description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description: Indicates whether the depth buffer should be cleared explicitly.
classitems.name: clearDepth

classitems.description:
Indicates whether the color, depth and stencil buffers should be cleared.

Even with clear set to true you can prevent specific buffers from being
cleared by setting either the autoClearColor, autoClearStencil or
autoClearDepth properties of the renderer to false.
classitems.name: clear

classitems.description:
Indicates whether the render target should be resized when the size of
the composer's read/write buffer changes.
classitems.name: resize

classitems.description: Adjusts the format of the render target.
classitems.name: initialise

params.name: alpha
params.description: - Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

classitems.description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description: The shader material to use for rendering.
classitems.name: material

classitems.description: The name of the color sampler uniform of the given material.
classitems.name: textureID

classitems.description: The object position in screen space.

classitems.description: The speed of the shock wave animation.

classitems.name: active

classitems.description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

classitems.description: A render target for the color edge detection.

classitems.description: A copy shader material used for rendering to texture.

classitems.description: Rounds the given number up to the next power of two.
classitems.name: ceil2
